content: betelgeuse fisticuffs these are worked from the cuff up… featured stitches half_double_crochet stitch half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet stuff you ll need 100% merino wool worsted weight 1 skein of black 1 skein of grey 1 hook size 7/4 5mm tapestry needle gauge 16 stitches and 12 row = 4 10cm in half_double_crochet with size a 7/ 4 5mm hook instructions cuff in black and leaving a long tail to finish with chain 10 turn row 1 crocheting in back loops only *single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across 9 sts chain 1 turn* row 2 35 repeat from * to * 36 row total join with slip_stitch to first chain forming a circular cuff attach grey yarn arm round 1 in grey chain 2 counts as 1st half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in the ends of row 2 41 42 hdcs total join with slip_stitch to top of first chain rnds 2 4 chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain rnds 5 - 8 change to black chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain rnds 9 12 in grey chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain rnds 13 - 16 in black *chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain rnds 17 20 in grey chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain rnds 21 - 28 in black *chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain round 29 thumb round in black chain 2 half_double_crochet in next stitch chain 6 skip next 4 hdcs half_double_crochet in next st and in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain rnds 30 - 37 in black *chain 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch to first chain fasten_off finish off
